name: abstainer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who does not do something, especially something they would like to do: His grandfather was a lifelong abstainer who never touched a drop of alcohol. Animal rights should extend to geese, say French foie gras abstainers.
someone who decides not to vote: The problem for protest voters or abstainers is registering the reason for their actions. The three abstainers argued the measure was unnecessary.
More examplesFewer examplesAbstainers do not necessarily enjoy better health than moderate drinkers.Jimmy Carter and both Presidents George Bush were reportedly abstainers, but Bill Clinton liked cigars from time to time.The government may lose the vote if there are too many abstainers.
